alert.note: Alert for Bath; Menifee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 1:22PM EDT until August 05 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Bath and Menifee. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 121 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area through 345 PM. This will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marshall, Olympia Springs, Olympia, Polksville, Rothwell and Hope. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
